result.execSummary:
All charges against Jeremy D Hanson in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Jeremy D Hanson is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jeremy D Hanson

records.addlTxt:
Case called at 10:31 AM.
Defendant Jeremy D Hanson not in court.  Attorney Karl A Schmidt not in court.  Prosecuting Attorney Tiffany M. Winter in court for the State of Wisconsin.
Hearing scheduled for October 3, 2022 at 09:30 am.
CK 44102 mailed to poster; signature bond ordered/signed, cash bond refunded.

Conditions: 
No contact with T.N. or the property of EC area school district. 
No acts or threats of violence against anyone. 
No use of the internet for anything other than work or school purposes.
Letter to defendant with signature bond ordered in court [date ordered]. Request to return signed bond and Affidavit of Witness form to Clerk of Court no later than 07/08/2022.

Conditions:
No contact with T.N. or property of EC Area School District.
No acts or threats of violence against anyone.
Not to use internet for anything other than work or school purposes.

9:48 AM case called. Prosecuting attorney Matthew Z Kirkpatrick in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Jeremy D Hanson appeared by video.  Attorney Karl A Schmidt in court for Jeremy D Hanson. 
Bond is amended from $2,000 cash bond to 10,000 signature bond with previous conditions still applying.  Settlement Conference (by phone) with District Attorney's Office (715-839-4828) on 8/24/22 at 2:30 PM. 
Return to court: 9-19-22 at 9:30 AM.

(Case called at 11:04 AM- by Zoom) Defendant Jeremy Hanson appears by video. Attorney Karl Schmidt appears in person for the Defendant. ADA Trenton Piltz appears in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Warrant quashed. State requests $2,000 cash bond- the Defendant has no ties to the State of Wisconsin. Defense requests the Defendant be released on his own recognizance- makes statement regarding federal case. Court orders $2,000 cash bond with various conditions. Time limits for preliminary hearing are waived. Court advises counsel to discuss how long the Defendant has to pay the bond. 
Pre-Trial Conference: 05/25/2022 at 1:15 PM.  Hearing: 06/28/2022 at 9:30 AM.

Conditions:
No contact with T.N. or the property of the Eau Claire Area School District.
No threatening or abusive communication with anyone.
Not to use the internet, unless for employment or legitimate reason (including court appearances).
Order approving request for Zoom for Return on Warrant Hearing 05/03/2022 at 11:00 a.m.
Return on warrant on May 3, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Dated 04/30/2022, Letter from Attorney Karl Schmidt to Court requesting return on warrant hearing via Zoom.

Exhibit to Zoom request letter
